lines.text: The distance between insanity and genius is measured only by success.

[Bond says goodbye in Danish to Moneypenny on the phone while making love to his language tutor]
Goodbye my sweet.
You always were a cunning linguist, James.

[M walks up from behind Moneypenny]
Don't ask.
Don't tell.
With all due respect, M, I think you don't have the balls for this job.
Perhaps. But the advantage is, I don't have to think with them all the time.
Mr. Jones, are we ready to release our new software?
Yes, sir. As requested, it's full of bugs, which means people will be forced to upgrade for years.
Outstanding.
It's the insurance damage waiver for your beautiful new car. Now, will you need collision coverage?
Yes.
Fire?
Probably.
Property destruction?
Definitely.
Personal Injury?
I hope not, but accidents do happen.
They frequently do with you.
Well, that takes care of the normal wear-and-tear. Is there any other protection I need?
Only from me 007, unless you bring that car back in pristine order.
You were pretty good with that hook.
Thanks. It comes from growing up in a rough neighborhood. You were pretty good on the bike.
Thank you. It comes from not growing up at all.
I always wondered how I'd feel if I ever saw you again.
[Paris turns around slaps Bond across the face]
Now I know. Was it something I said?
How about the words, "I'll be right back"?
Something came up.
Something always came up.
[the phone in Bond's car ring]
Yes?
Good Morning, Mr. Bond. Elliot Carver. I beleive you have two things that belong to me!
What are you talking about?
The encoder, in the dash of your car...
[pause]
...And my wife, in your hotel room!
[last lines]
They're looking for us, James.
Let's stay under cover.
I owe you an unpleasant death, Mr. Bond.

[after throwing a bad guy into a printing press]
They'll print anything these days.

According to Eastern philosophy, the body has seven different chakra points. The Energy centers, like the heart, or genitals. The purpose of these implements is to probe those organs, inflicting the maximum amount of pain whilst keeping the victim alive for as long as possible.
Dr. Kaufman's record was fifty-two hours. I'm hoping to break it.
I would have thought watching your TV shows was torture enough.
[Carver has just informed his department heads of the sinking of the Devonshire]

Gentlemen, and ladies, hold the presses. This just in. By curious quirk of fate, we have the perfect story with which to launch our satellite news network tonight. It seems a small crisis is brewing in the South China Seas. I want full newspaper coverage, I want magazine stories, I want books, I want films, I want TV, I want radio, I want us on the air 24 hours a day, this is our moment! And a billion people around this planet will watch it, hear it, and read about it from the Carver Media Group.
[pause]
There's no news, like bad news.
[Bond has taken Gupta hostage and is negotiating with Carver to exchange him for Wai Lin, who herself is being held captive by Carver]

[to Stamper and his security forces regarding Bond]
Don't shoot him, yet.

[to his men over a two-way radio]
Hold your fire.
Welcome to my world crisis, Mr. Bond!
Even trade, Elliot; Gupta for Wai Lin. You can't fire the missile without him.

[Holding Wai Lin at gunpoint]
And it seems you can't resist any woman in my possession.
What are you waiting for, shoot him!

[to Wai Lin]
I told you, we're gonna finish this together!
How romantic! Do you realize how absurd your position is?
No more absurd than starting a war for ratings.

Great men have always manipulated the media to save the world. Look at William Randolph Hearst, who told his photographers, "You provide the pictures, I'll provide the war." I've just taken it one step further.
[Bond open fires on one of Stamper's men, killing him]
Sorry about that, I've tuned out there for a moment, Elliot.

[to Bond]
Touché.
[to Gupta]
Mr. Gupta, is the missile ready to fire?
Press the magic button, Beijing disappears.
Well, it seems you've outlived your contract!
[Carver shoots Gupta]
You see, Mr. Bond, I have a backup plan
Uh-huh. So do I.
[Bond remotely releases a grenade from a case and detonates it, breaching the hull of the stealth boat]
Mr. Wallace, call the President. Tell him if he doesn't sign the bill lowering the cable rates, we will release the video of him with the cheerleader in the Chicago motel room.
Inspired, sir.
And after he signs the bill, release the tape anyway.
Consider him slimed.
Do you know I used to look in the papers every day for your obituary.
Well, I'm sorry I keep disappointing you.
[to Carver before he is kiled by the sea-vac]
You forgot the first rule of mass media, Elliot! GIVE THE PEOPLE WHAT THEY WANT!
Another Carver building. If I didn't know better, I'd say he developed an edifice complex.
do you still sleep with a gun under your pillow?

This is very embarrassing. It seems there is a red box they need in your car, only they can't get it open. They want me to get you to tell how to open it. I feel like an idiot, I don't know what to say.
[Bond just smiles]
I am to torture you if you don't do it.
Do you have a doctorate in that as well?
No, no this is more like a hobby... but I am very gifted.
Oh, I believe you.
[Bond's transmission has shown a known terrorist holding a missing American GPS encoding device]
I wonder with what'll the CIA be more upset - that they lost it, or that we found it?
Here's your cell phone. Talk here, listen here.
So that's what I've been doing wrong for all these years?

[straddling Bond on a motorcycle]
Don't get any ideas, Mr Bond.
I wouldn't dream of it.
My art is in great demand, Mr. Bond. I go all over the world. I am especially good at the celebrity overdose.
Mr. Carver here is the banker Mr.
[pause]
Bond, James Bond.

[aims his gun at Bond]
But now, Mr. Bond, I am afraid that our little...
[burst of static from his earpiece]
Ah, Stamper! Stop yelling in my ear, ja?
Sir, they can't get into the car.
Oh, you can't be serious. Did you call the Auto Club?
Do *you* want to call them? Make him tell you how to open it.
O-O-Okay. Ja, I ask.
Good morning, my golden retrievers. What kind of havoc shall the Carver Media Group create in the world today? News?
Floods in Pakistan, riots in Paris, and a plane crash in California.
Outstanding!
Mr. Bond, Ms. Lin. Welcome to Saigon. Please come in.
It's always a pleasure to see you, Elliot.
I wasn't planning on opening this center until tomorrow. But you're just in time to help me finish writing the inaugural story, YOUR obituaries.
You know that, officially, Uncle Sam is completely neutral in this turkey shoot.
And unofficially?
We have no interest in seeing World War III - unless we start it.

[Bond and Wai-Lin are handcuffed together]
If I didn't know better, I'd say you were following me around, Mr. Bond.
we seem to have developed a certain attachment to each other.
Hopefully not for long.
I call it "Gupta's Law of Convenient Anomalies" - if it looks too good to be true, it probably is.
Soon I'll have reached out to and influenced more people than anybody in the history of this planet, save God himself. And the best he ever managed was the Sermon on the Mount.
Don't you realise how absurd your position is?
No more absurd than starting a war for ratings.

[to Russian General]
Can't you people keep anything locked up?
I think we understand each other.
Grow up, 007.
[referring to the headline "The Empire WILL strike back"]
I rather like the last one. It isn't even mine.

[bobbing in the South China Sea in scuba gear]
Still interested in hostile takeovers?
It's the opportunities for travel, that I like best about banking.
It's mostly dull routine, of course, but every now and then you get to sail on a beautiful evening like this. And sometimes work with a decadent agent of a corrupt Western power.
And they say communists don't know how to have fun.
Oh, I hate to disappoint you; but, I don't even have a little red book.
[the Royal Navy has launched a cruise missile at a terrorist site Bond is surveying - Robinson gets on communications line with Bond]
White knight, 4 minutes to impact. Get out of there.
[pause]
Yes, dammit, I know what it is, it's on the screen in front of me. It's a jeep in front of a plane! Now get the hell OUT of there!
What the hell is going on?

[to Bond]
You will NOT wait! That is an order!
What is your man waiting for?
White Knight?
[Robinson reacts with horror to something on the screen]
Oh my God, those are Soviet SB-5 nuclear torpedoes! If the cruise hits them...
Order them to abort the missile!

[picks up phone]
HMS Chester, urgent, Abort missile! Abort missile!
Now, Captain? Whatever the hell that thing is, sink it.
[first lines]

Our man's in position on the center camera. It's like a terrorist supermarket. Chinese Long March Scud, Panther AS-565 attack helicopter, a pair of Russian mortars, and the crates look like American rifles. Chilean mines. German explosives. Fun for the whole family.
Hello Elliot, interesting plan!
So much for German Efficiency!

[after Bond hears the female voice in the car]
I think we've met.
When I was sixteen, I went to work for a newspaper in Hong Kong. It was a rag, but the editor taught me one important lesson. The key to a great story is not who, or what, or when, but why.

[on the motorcycle]
Get on the back!
Why? Are you trying to protect me?
No, I need to balance the bike. Now get on the back!
[finding Paris's body in his hotel room, Bond suddenly realizes the news report in the background is reporting his death along with hers]

[click]
I have a clear shot at your head, Mr. Bond. Stand up, slowly, drop your gun, and kick it towards me, ja?
[Bond does so]
Good. Now sit down on the bed next to Mrs. Carver.
[Bond does so, and Kaufman turns off the TV and extracts a videotape from the VCR]
The story will be on the news in an hour.
"Tomorrow's News Today."
Just so.
PWO, Is that target too small for missile lock?
Yes, sir.

[sits to calculate a manual firing solution]
Ok, we'll have to do this the old fashioned way.

[during car chase]
Warning! Unsafe driving will void warranty!
[Bond is practicing speaking Danish with his language tutor; while making love to her]
I am pleased with your progress, Mr. Bond.
I've always enjoyed studying a new tongue, Professor.
One might say you have a natural ability.
But practice makes perfect.
Filthy Habit!
[Carver is revealing his plan to Wai Lin]

What you are about to witness, Ms. Lin, is not so much a missile attack, but the launch of a new world order. In precisely five minutes after your countrymen have attacked the British fleet, I shall retaliate for dear old England by sending this missile into Beijing, where General Chang has just called an emergency meeting of the Chinese High Command. Unfortunately, General Chang will be delayed in traffic, arriving just after the missile has killed your leaders, and too late to stop the air force from sinking the entire British fleet, but he will be just in time to take over the Government, negotiate a truce, and emerge as a world leader, with the Nobel Peace Prize.
And what do you get?
Me? oh, nothing. Just exclusive broadcasting rights in China for the next hundred years.
I believe you once had a relationship with Carver's wife, Paris.
That was a long time ago, M... before she was married. I didn't realize it was public knowledge.
Queen and country, James.
Your job is to find out whether Carver or someone in his organization sent that ship off course, and why. Use your relationship with Mrs. Carver, if necessary.
I doubt if she'll remember me.
Remind her. Then pump her for information.
You'll just have to decide how much pumping is needed, James.
If only that were true of you and I, Moneypenny.

[prepping Bond for jump]
You free-fall for 5 miles and use your oxygen or you will die of asphyxiation.
Sounds like my first marriage!
[laughs]
It won't look like a suicide if you shoot me from over there.
I am a professor of forensic medicine. Believe me, Mr. Bond, I could shoot you from Stuttgart und still create ze proper effect.
Are you sure you can do this on your own?
It depends whether your mission is peace or revenge.
This is about stopping a war.
[Gupta targets the stolen cruise missile at Beijing, then signals the bridge]
Ready to rock and ruin!

[Calling on the phone]
James? Where are you?

[In bed with a Danish Professor]
Oh, Moneypenny. Um. I'm just up here at Oxford, brushing up on a little Danish.
Little?
I'm afraid you're going to have to kiss off your lesson, James. We've got a situation here at the Ministry of Defense. We're sending the fleet to China.
Your new BMW 750. All the usual refinements. Machine guns. Rockets. The GPS tracking system.
I am not interested in your sordid escapades. Let's get on with it, shall we. Your new telephone. Talk here. Listen here.
So that's what I've been doing wrong all these years.
Look, it also includes a fingerprint scanner. a 2,000 volt security system, and this I'm particularly proud of - the remote control for your car. Tap twice. One. Two.
[Car starts]
Now, draw very slowly across the pad to drive the car. It's surprisingly difficult to drive; but, with practice...
Well, let's see how she responds to my touch, eh, Q?
Something to drink, Mrs. Carver?
Mr. Bond will have Vodka martini, shaken, not stirred.
Mrs. Carver will have a Tequila, straight shot.
No. Mrs. Carver will have a glass of Mr. Carver's champagne.

[Making a toast]
To you.
No, to the gun.

[to Bond]
If it comes to a choice between you and Elliot I've made my bed. You don't sleep in it anymore.

[sighs]
What was it James? Did I get too close? Did I get to close for - comfort?
Yes.
[Passionate kiss, then Bond undresses Paris]
I missed you.
Don't argue with me James. You know, this job of yours - eh, it's murder on relationships.
Yo! Jimbo!
Wade, what the hell are you doing here?
Jimbo, you know the world's my office.

Fire one missile at the flagship of each fleet. The Chinese will think the British are rattling the saber. The British will think the Chinese are being belligerent. And the media will provide cool, objective coverage. - Let the mayhem begin.

[Sees Wai-Lin on a surveillance camera]
What the hell do I pay you for! If she's there, Bond is there. Stamper, find them
Stamper to bridge. Bond is dead.
Delicious!

Even if they were looking for me, we're on a stealth boat! They can't see me. Or, you. Or, even - your friend, the late Commander Bond. Who is on leave at this moment on his way to the bottom of the South China Sea. He' my new anchor man!
I may have some breaking news for you, Elliot.
Never argue with a woman. They're always right.

[referring to Bond and Wai Lin]
Mr Stamper, would you please kill those bastards!
Mr. Gupta, is the missile ready to launch?
Press the magic button, Beijing disappears!
Well, it seems you've outlived your contract!
[Carver shoots Gupta, instantly killing him]
You see, Mr. Bond, I have a backup plan!
U-huh... So do I!
Drop the knife Mr. Bond or I drop your friend.
Why did you marry him?
He told me he loved me.
That always sounds good.

[on the phone]
Bond here.
